hook.text: A raw music file is 50 MB. An MP3 is 5 MB. Compression makes that possible.

buildup.text: Lossless compression finds patterns and removes redundancy without losing any data.

discovery.text: Lossy compression throws away data humans can't perceive â€” inaudible sounds, invisible pixels.

twist.text: JPEG, MP3, and H.264 all discard information. What you see and hear is an approximation.

climax.text: Without compression, streaming video and music would require ten times the bandwidth.

punchline.text: Everything you stream is a clever approximation.

quiz.question: What does lossy compression throw away?
